qas.question: How many elements did the Chinese philosophers think the world was made of?
What element was red associated with in Chinese philosophy?
At the time of the Han dynasty where would one fine the color Red?
In the time of the Ming Dynasty one would find what color used during sacrificial offerings?
Outside of Fire and Earth, what three other elements did Chinese philosophers say the world was composed from?
What is the color of Chinese philosophy?

plausible_answers.text: metal, wood, water, fire and earth

qas.question: What five elements is the world made of according to the Ming dynasty?
What color was associated with water?

context: <b5_0>Red<b5_0/> played an important role in Chinese philosophy. It was believed that the world was composed of <a0_0>five<a0_0/> elements: <a4_0><b6_0>metal, wood, water<a4_0/>, fire and earth<b6_0/>, and that each had a color. <a3_0><b7_0>Red<b7_0/><a3_0/> was associated with <a1_0>fire<a1_0/>. Each Emperor chose the color that his fortune-tellers believed would bring the most prosperity and good fortune to his reign. During the Zhou, Han, Jin, Song and Ming Dynasties, red considered a noble color, and it was featured in <a2_0>all court ceremonies<a2_0/>, from coronations to sacrificial offerings, and weddings.
